title: Ticket #6426: RemoteUserCpu never updated in history file
description:
FNAL reports that RemoteUserCpu and RemoteSysCpu for all jobs is correctly reported in the user log, but both are always zero in the history file.

Investigation reveals that the classad parsing optimization work we did for the 8.7.0 release shortcutted over some of the dirty attribute tracking. This means that real-valued attributes that change over lifetime of a classad are never marked dirty, so the shadow doesn't think they are changed, and doesn't send them to the schedd for permanent storage.

This dirty tracking code is also used in the job router and the gridmanager, we're looking at whether this breaks them as well.
